intro: Scorzonera caricifolia, commonly known as the thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmate leaves that are deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine environments. Scorzonera caricifolia is also known for its edible tubers, which have been historically used in traditional cuisines.
